intro: Hieracium pseudimbricatum, commonly known as the false hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are heart-shaped with rough, hairy surfaces, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
